 [http://www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Gravur+Conden...](http://web.archive.org/web/20141108102117/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Gravur+Condensed/ "http://www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Gravur+Condensed/")

Designed by [Cornel Windlin](http://web.archive.org/web/20141108102117/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Cornel%20Windlin) & [Gilles Gavillet](http://web.archive.org/web/20141108102117/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Gilles%20Gavillet) 1996-2001

Published by [Lineto](http://web.archive.org/web/20141108102117/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Lineto)

One of the key features of everyday life in switzerland is standardisation, ranging from the look of waste bags to the design of letterboxes. interestingly, and maybe perversely, 99% of all swiss letterboxes and door bells are inscribed in exactly the same way. there must be a whole army of name plate engravers all over the country, all using exactly the type style. i redraw the font together with gilles gavillet, generating 5 different weights (and an unpublished set of 5 alternate fonts).
author: AndrewSipe
